actor_awards.notes: One of the few entertainers to have won an EGOT (Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, and Tony). A titan of the British stage, he was knighted in 1953. He won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for Arthur.

filmography.title: Arthur
filmography.role_description: The acerbic, fiercely loyal valet to a drunken billionaire playboy.
filmography.plot: A drunken playboy stands to lose a wealthy inheritance when he falls for a woman his family doesn't like.

filmography.title: Gandhi
filmography.role_description: The British Viceroy of India who negotiates with Gandhi.
filmography.plot: The life of the lawyer who became the famed leader of the Indian revolts against the British rule through his philosophy of nonviolent protest.

filmography.title: Julius Caesar
filmography.role_description: The manipulative senator who instigates the plot to assassinate Caesar.
filmography.plot: The growing ambition of Julius Caesar is a source of major concern to his close friend Brutus and a group of conspirators.

filmography.title: The Elephant Man
filmography.role_description: The head of the hospital committee who is initially skeptical of allowing John Merrick to stay.
filmography.plot: A Victorian surgeon rescues a heavily disfigured man who is mistreated while scraping a living as a side-show freak.
filmography.awards: Grammy: Win – Best Spoken Word Album (Film Cast)

filmography.title: Murder on the Orient Express
filmography.role_description: The polite and proper valet to the murder victim, Mr. Ratchett.
filmography.plot: In December 1935, when his train is stopped by deep snow, detective Hercule Poirot is called on to solve a murder that occurred in his car the night before.

filmography.title: Becket
filmography.role_description: The King of France who navigates the political conflict between Henry II and Thomas Becket.
filmography.plot: Henry II surprises England by naming his fellow rogue and confidant Thomas Becket as Chancellor, but the relationship deteriorates when Becket takes his duties seriously.

filmography.title: Prospero's Books
filmography.role_description: The exiled Duke of Milan who uses magic to manipulate the survivors of a shipwreck.
filmography.plot: An exiled magician finds an opportunity for revenge against his enemies when they are shipwrecked on his island.

filmography.title: Chariots of Fire
filmography.role_description: The head of Trinity College who questions the priorities of the student athletes.
filmography.plot: Two British track athletes, one a determined Jew and the other a devout Christian, compete in the 1924 Olympics.

filmography.title: Secret Agent
filmography.role_description: A British novelist recruited to spy on the Germans during WWI.
filmography.plot: British agents are sent to Switzerland to assassinate a German spy, but they are unsure of his identity.

filmography.title: Richard III
filmography.role_description: The brother of King Edward IV and Richard, who is betrayed and murdered in the Tower of London.
filmography.plot: Richard, Duke of Gloucester, eliminates those ahead of him in line for the throne, then declares himself King Richard III.

filmography.title: Providence
filmography.role_description: An aging, ill writer who spends a sleepless night composing a story involving his family.
filmography.plot: The confused and alcohol-influenced imagination of an aging writer reshapes the characters of his family into a final novel.
filmography.awards: New York Film Critics Circle: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: The Charge of the Light Brigade
filmography.role_description: The distracted and out-of-touch commander of the British forces during the Crimean War.
filmography.plot: A chronicle of the events that led to the British involvement in the Crimean War against Russia and the siege of Sevastopol.

filmography.title: The Shooting Party
filmography.role_description: An animal rights activist who disrupts an aristocratic hunting party.
filmography.plot: A gathering of nobles at an English estate in 1913 leads to tragic consequences, foreshadowing the First World War.
filmography.awards: Los Angeles Film Critics Association: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Shine
filmography.role_description: A legendary music professor who mentors the young prodigy David Helfgott.
filmography.plot: The true story of pianist David Helfgott, driven to a mental breakdown by his domineering father and later finding peace.
filmography.awards: Screen Actors Guild: Nomination – Outstanding Performance by a Cast

filmography.title: Elizabeth
filmography.role_description: Pope Pius V, who opposes the Protestant Queen Elizabeth.
filmography.plot: The early years of the reign of Elizabeth I of England and her difficult task of learning what is necessary to be a monarch.

filmography.title: The Loved One
filmography.role_description: An expatriate artist working in Hollywood who hangs himself after being fired.
filmography.plot: A young British poet visits his uncle in Los Angeles and gets involved in the funeral business.

filmography.title: Saint Joan
filmography.role_description: The English Earl who orchestrates the trial and execution of Joan of Arc.
filmography.plot: In 1429, a teenage girl from a remote French village stands before her king with a message from God: she will defeat the world's greatest army and liberate her country.

filmography.title: Oh! What a Lovely War
filmography.role_description: The Austro-Hungarian foreign minister depicted in this satirical musical.
filmography.plot: The history of World War I is told through a series of musical numbers and sketches.

filmography.title: The Whistle Blower
filmography.role_description: A high-ranking official involved in a cover-up within the British intelligence community.
filmography.plot: An English war veteran investigates the mysterious death of his son, who worked at a secret government facility.

filmography.title: 11 Harrowhouse
filmography.role_description: The ruthless owner of a diamond exchange who forces an employee to commit a robbery.
filmography.plot: A diamond merchant and his girlfriend rob the world's largest diamond exchange.

filmography.title: Lion of the Desert
filmography.role_description: A Libyan collaborator who tries to persuade the rebel leader Omar Mukhtar to surrender.
filmography.plot: In 1929, Italian fascist dictator Benito Mussolini sends General Rodolfo Graziani to Italian Libya to crush the resistance led by Omar Mukhtar.

filmography.title: Plenty
filmography.role_description: A British diplomat who resigns in protest over the Suez Crisis.
filmography.plot: A woman who fought in the French Resistance during WWII struggles to adjust to life in post-war England.
filmography.awards: Los Angeles Film Critics Association: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Appointment with Death
filmography.role_description: A British official in Jerusalem who asks Poirot to investigate a murder.
filmography.plot: Hercule Poirot investigates the murder of the sadistic matriarch of a wealthy family during a vacation in the Holy Land.

filmography.title: Around the World in 80 Days
filmography.role_description: The valet Phileas Fogg fires at the beginning of the film.
filmography.plot: A Victorian Englishman bets that with the new steamships and railways he can circumnavigate the globe in eighty days.

filmography.title: The Good Companions
filmography.role_description: A schoolteacher who quits his job to join a traveling concert party.
filmography.plot: Three musicians join forces to save a failing traveling show.

filmography.title: The Portrait of a Lady
filmography.role_description: The wealthy uncle of the protagonist who leaves her a fortune.
filmography.plot: A lady faces a lineup of suitors, but her life becomes complicated when she falls for a man who is not what he seems.

filmography.title: First Knight
filmography.role_description: An elder advisor to King Arthur.
filmography.plot: Lancelot falls in love with Guinevere, who is due to marry King Arthur. Meanwhile, a violent warlord tries to seize power from Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table.
